Tweet: The Blessed Lord said: Again, O mighty-armed Arjuna, listen to My supreme word, which I shall speak to you for your benefit and which will give you great joy.
The gods and great sages do not know my origin, for I am the source of the gods and sages in all respects.
He who knows Me as the unborn, as the supreme Lord of all worlds, he, undeluded among mortals, is freed from all sins.
Intelligence, knowledge, non-delusion, forgiveness, truth, control over the senses, control over the mind, pleasure, pain, birth, death, fear, and fearlessness.
Non-violence, equality, contentment, penance, charity, fame and infamy - these various qualities exist in beings by nature.
The seven great sages and four ancient Manus, who are born out of my mind, are the progenitors of this world.
He who knows in truth this glory and power of Mine engages in unswerving devotion; there is no doubt about it.
I am the source of all; from Me everything evolves. Knowing this, the wise with deep devotion adore Me.
With their minds fixed on Me, their life surrendered to Me, enlightening one another and always speaking of Me, they are contented and delighted.
To those who are constantly devoted and who worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.
For their welfare, Arjuna, I, dwelling in their hearts, dispel the darkness born of ignorance with the luminous lamp of knowledge.
Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the ultimate abode, the purest, the Absolute Truth. You are the eternal, divine, original person, the unborn, the greatest.
Sages, gods, divine sages, Narada, Asita, Devala, Vyasa, and you yourself have declared this to me.
I believe all that You have said, O Krishna; neither the gods nor the demons comprehend Your manifestation.
You alone know yourself, O Supreme Person, O Creator of all beings, O God of gods, O Lord of the universe.
You should speak of these divine manifestations in their entirety. By these manifestations, pervading the worlds, you abide.
How can I know You, always meditating on You, O Lord? In which forms and in which aspects are You to be meditated upon by me?

Please explain the following text in English:

In detail, the science of the Self, O Janardana, and also about divine manifestations. For, O listener, there is no satiety in hearing about the nectar-like words of mine.
The Supreme Lord said: O Arjuna, now I shall describe to you My divine manifestations, which are prominent, not all, as there is no end to their extent.
I am the Self, O Gudakesha, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.
Among the Adityas I am Vishnu, among the luminaries I am the radiant sun. Among the Maruts I am Marichi, and among the stars I am the moon.
I am the Sama Veda among the Vedas; I am Indra among the gods. I am the mind among the senses; I am consciousness in living beings.
Of the Rudras I am Shankara, of the Yakshas and Rakshasas I am the Lord of Wealth; of the Vasus I am Pavaka, and of the mountains I am Meru.
Know Me to be the chief among the priests, O Arjuna. Among the commanders of armies, I am Skanda; and among bodies of water, I am the ocean.
Among the sages I am Bhá¹›gu; among words I am the one syllable. Among sacrifices I am the sacrifice of silent repetition, and among the immovable I am the Himalayas.
The fig tree, among all trees, the celestial sage Narada, among the celestial musicians, Chitraratha, among the perfected beings, the sage Kapila.
Know Me to be the king of elephants, Airavata, and among horses, the Ucchaihshravas, born of the elixir of immortality.
I am the thunderbolt among weapons, and the wish-fulfilling cow among cows. I am the procreator, the god of love, and I am Vasuki among snakes.
Among the nagas, I am Ananta; among the aquatic beings, I am Varuna. Among the ancestors, I am Aryama; and among the controllers, I am Yama.
I am Prahlada among the demons, and Time among the reckoners of time. Among animals, I am the lion, and among birds, I am Garuda.
I am the wind among the purifiers, I am Rama among the warriors, I am the crocodile among the fish, and I am the Ganges among the rivers.
I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings, O Arjuna. Among sciences I am the science of the Self, and I am the logic of those who debate.
I am the letter "A" among the alphabets and I am the dual compound of words. I am also inexhaustible time, and I am the all-devouring death.
Death, I am the destroyer of all, and I am also the generator of the future. Fame, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence, resolve, and forgiveness are the qualities of women.
I am the Gayatri meter of the great Sama mantras. I am the month of Margashirsha among the seasons, and I am the flower-bearing season of the Devas.
I am gambling among cheats, and I am the brilliance of the brilliant. I am victory, I am effort, and I am the strength of the strong.
I am Vasudeva among the Vrishnis, Dhananjaya among the Pandavas, Vyasa among the sages, and Shuka among the poets.
Punishment, I am the rod of those who punish; policy, I am the strategy of those who seek victory; silence, I am the secret of the wise; knowledge, I am the knowledge of the knowledgeable.
And whatever seed of all beings, Arjuna, I am that. There is no being, moving or unmoving, that can exist without Me.
There is no end to my divine manifestations, Arjuna. This is just a brief description by me of the extent of my divine manifestations.
"Whatever glorious, powerful, or brilliant you see, know it to be a manifestation of a fraction of my splendor."
Or what need is there for you to know all this, O Arjuna? With a single fragment of Myself I pervade and support this entire universe.
